body: @ThunderCl0ud that's a bit gory and detailed, but I suppose it is poetic in a sense. For me, I would describe it more as a feeling of warm ectascy that gently holds you in comfort and protection, as though it is not your heart being heated with such sight of innocent love, but your soul as it believes that such love can exist and you hope to hold it in your arms in gentleness and protectiveness. At least, that's how I feel when reading NaruHina doujins.

If you rip apart my ribcage, and tear the flesh in between, grab my beating heart, and toss it in a microwave, 

It'll simulate what I'm feeling right now fucker.
